image.altText: A white plane wing with  red tip

props.synopsis: Hackers have released personal data from Qantas customers onto the dark web, following a cyber attack in July.

title.children: Qantas customers' data leaked to dark web after cyber attack

image.altText: Building with thick white steam coming out

props.synopsis: A power supply agreement between Australia's only producer of newsprint, which is used in newspapers, and Tasmania's state-owned energy retailer is reached.

title.children: Stalemate broken as Australia's last paper mill secures power deal

image.altText: A purple NDIS sign on the side of an office building.

props.synopsis: Proceedings began against the now-defunct provider following the death of a Queensland participant in 2023. The penalty is the highest civil sanction imposed on an NDIS provider to date.

title.children: NDIS provider fined $2.2m after man killed walking into highway traffic

image.altText: A mother in a warm cardigan stands in a well lit kitchen, carefully holding a mug of tea.

props.synopsis: Researchers are trying to fix the "Western bias" contained in many DNA databases with a new national project targeting multicultural communities.

title.children: 'Heavily biased': Who's missing from our DNA databases?

image.altText: Displaced Palestinians walk with their belongings past destroyed buildings

props.synopsis: Displaced for the past two years, Palestinians begin returning to their destroyed homes in Gaza as the Israel-Hamas war ceasefire takes effect.

title.children: UN agencies still waiting for details on aid rollout for 'critical' Gaza relief

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Gazans relived and joyful — but also hesistant
How the hostage-prisoner exchange is expected to unfold
UN given green light to deliver scaled-up aid

image.altText: Trump sitting across Netanyahu.

props.synopsis: In the tragic arc of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, Donald Trump may have closed the latest — and most violent — chapter.

title.children: Trump has strong-armed Netanyahu, who was planning a longer war

image.altText: A person in dark clothing holding a long edged weapon.

props.synopsis: Investigators say a brawl between two groups armed with machetes spilled into a shopping centre in Broadmeadows on Friday night.

title.children: Police investigate machete brawl at Melbourne shopping centre

image.altText: Derek Gee rides his bike

props.synopsis: Canadian cyclist Derek Gee terminates his contract with Israel-Premier Tech due to a "safety and personal-belief" standpoint, but says the team is seeking damages worth 30 million Euros ($54 million) as a result.

title.children: 'Weighed heavily on my conscience': Cyclist faces $54m 'damages' bill

image.altText: A young girl sits in a field touching her ear and holds out her hand.

props.synopsis: Fourteen-year-old Isla Steed has unique challenges as one of just four people in Australia diagnosed with CHOPS syndrome.

title.children: Only four people in Australia have been diagnosed with this rare disease

image.altText: Trump waves as he walks across a lawn

props.synopsis: A memo released by US President Donald Trump's doctor says the 79-year-old's "cardiac age" is 14 years younger than his "chronological age".

title.children: Trump remains in 'exceptional health', doctor's note says after check-up

image.altText: shellharbour plane crash 1

props.synopsis: Officers from Lake Illawarra Police District were informed that a light aircraft crashed shortly after take-off on Saturday morning.

title.children: 'No chance of being saved': Three killed in NSW plane crash

image.altText: A man in a vibrant blue suit looks to his side and frowns

props.synopsis: The US military is moving forward with plans to build a dedicated facility in Idaho to train pilots from Qatar. But not everyone is happy.

title.children: Why Trump allies are at odds over Qatari military training facility

image.altText: 5 planes fly in the air with red white and blue gas tailing behind.

props.synopsis: Taiwan will build a new multi-layered air defence system called "T-Dome" to defend itself against enemy threats, President Lai Ching-te has said.

title.children: Taiwan unveils 'T-Dome' air defence system plans to counter China threat

image.altText: A mbald man sitting a computer witha colourful display of data on the screen.

props.synopsis: University of Queensland researcher Arutha Kulasinghe studied lung biopsies from the tumours of almost 250 patients with non-small cell lung cancer across Australia, the United States and Europe.

title.children: A life dedicated to cancer research leads to 'revolutionary' finding

image.altText: A plane engine filmed mid-flight above Broken Hill.

props.synopsis: A Broken Hill councillor was on a home-bound flight from Sydney when one of the plane's engines stopped mid-air, in an incident that was "terrifying at every stage".

title.children: Rex passenger describes 'terrifying' mid-air engine failure days after fire

image.altText: A person holds a mobile phone with a red cross through an image of a person speaking

props.synopsis: A constitutional fight is brewing over Australia's world-first social media ban, according to top legal scholars.

title.children: The right teen could be key in brewing legal fight over social media ban

image.altText: Brodie Kostecki and Todd Hazelwood celebrating taking pole position at Bathurst 1000.

props.synopsis: Brodie Kostecki claims pole at the Bathurst 1000, becoming just the third driver in Supercars history to start at the top of the grid three years in a row.

title.children: Defending champ Kostecki takes historic Bathurst 1000 pole

image.altText: A middle-aged blonde woman in glasses looks pensive as she sits at a laptop.

props.synopsis: Property analysts, brokers and banks report more borrowers are taking on big housing debts in their late 40s and 50s and, potentially, a retirement still saddled with mortgage repayments.

title.children: Mortgage holders may soon face similar dilemma to renters in retirement

image.altText: A small black dog with its tongue sticking out and looking at camera

props.synopsis: The Bunbury Magistrates Court hears how Stanley J Clemons shot his neighbour's dog and discarded its body, which still has not been found.

title.children: Neighbour shot and killed barking chihuahua and hid it, court told

image.altText: Nestory Irankunda slides on his knees

props.synopsis: Nestory Irankunda's late strike has given the Socceroos a 1-0 victory over FIFA 2026 World Cup co-hosts Canada in in Montreal.

title.children: Late Irankunda goal seals Socceroos win over Canada in Montreal

image.altText: Sebastien Lecornu whispers to France's President Emmanuel Macron.

props.synopsis: 39-year-old Sebastian Lecornu, who was first elected prime minister on September 9 but resigned on Monday after 26 days in office, says he changed his mind "out of duty", with France

title.children: Macron reappoints Lecornu as France's PM four days after his resignation

image.altText: Nevada regulators grill Ainsworth boss

props.synopsis: Regulators in the world's most influential gaming jurisdiction have dismissed a licence bid by the boss of Australia's Ainsworth Game Technology, branding him "arrogant", "misleading" and lacking in "emotional intelligence".

title.children: Las Vegas hearing turns nightmare for boss of Australian pokies giant

image.altText: Maria Grazia Chiuri (1)

props.synopsis: Men sit at the top of the world's fashion houses while women designers get torn apart online.

title.children: You might end up wearing fashion's misogyny problem

image.altText: Shirtless man in sporting ring with hands out

props.synopsis: Police had intelligence that Sydney's Alameddine organised crime network wanted a former UFC fighter dead more than 18 months before his shooting murder this week.

title.children: Police believe crime network targeted UFC fighter in retaliation for 'drug rip'

image.altText: A black and white photo of two men in slouched hats

props.synopsis: It started a researcher down a rabbit hole "beyond anything anyone could ever dream up", involving deception, double agents, secret names and plans for a genocide.

title.children: The Australian POWs who became double agents and uncovered genocidal plans

image.altText: Fire on the ground following an explosion.

props.synopsis: The explosion at Accurate Energetic Systems in rural Tennessee on Friday morning is heard from miles away and is described by local law enforcement as "one of the worst" tragedies the area has seen.

title.children: Blast at US munitions plant leaves 19 people feared dead

image.altText: Two people with full face helmets sit in a jet boat as it races fast on water

props.synopsis: From tractors to jet boats at Elmore, as Victoria prepares to host Australian series jet boat event in 2026.

title.children: V8 jet boats set to roar in Victoria at new custom built track

image.altText: Sunrise over a pier at lake macquarie in toronto new south wales

props.synopsis: An atmospheric "tug of war" for control of Australia's weather is taking place this spring, and it is a forecasting nightmare.

title.children: Promised rain overwhelmed by dry westerlies, chaotic weather forecast

image.altText: Ebony Marinoff and Madison Newman embrace as they celebrate an AFLW goal for the Adelaide Crows.

props.synopsis: Finals-bound Adelaide avoids back-to-back AFLW defeats, while Hawthorn moves into provisional second place after getting past Gold Coast.

title.children: Crows bounce back with strong win over Eagles as Hawks move up ladder

image.altText: Brad Battin

props.synopsis: Opposition leader Brad Battin has brought in Kew MP Jess Wilson as shadow treasurer and promoted three first-term MPs.

title.children: Victorian opposition unveils new shadow cabinet ahead of 2026 state election

image.altText: A woman in a hijab sits in rubble with tears in her eyes

props.synopsis: When 25-year-old Nour imagines herself back home in Gaza City, she remembers the things that made her smile. Now that's all gone.

title.children: From occupation to destruction: How Israel made so much of Gaza unliveable

image.altText: Two men depart a table going in opposite directions

props.synopsis: The US President takes to Truth Social to say he sees "no reason" to meet Xi Jinping after Beijing's "hostile" move to restrict rare-earth exports.

title.children: Trump imposes new 'massive' tariffs on China after rare earths move

image.altText: A WWE replica belt hangs around a man's neck. He stands in the middle of a large crowd.

props.synopsis: Wrestling mania hits Perth, with a three-day World Wrestling Entertainment blockbuster featuring stars like John Cena expected to draw tens of thousands of people.

title.children: Huge crowds flood Perth for WWE blockbuster featuring John Cena

image.altText: People walking along Pall Mall in Bendigo.

props.synopsis: A collection of photographs taken by an amateur photographer in a regional Victorian city in the 1950s, 60s and 70s has been returned.

title.children: Trove of historical photos taken by a tailor a 'brilliant time capsule'
